markers.label: Clenched Fists / Tense Stance
markers.feedback: Your hands are clenched into fists, which can signal tension or aggression to the audience. Try to consciously relax your hands, keeping them open at your sides to project a more calm and approachable demeanor.

markers.label: Weak introduction
markers.feedback: The video starts abruptly without providing any context. Try beginning with a clear opening statement to help your audience understand the topic and what to expect.

markers.label: Incomplete thought
markers.feedback: The video ends mid-sentence, leaving the main point unfinished. Ensure your message has a clear beginning, middle, and end to be effective. Planning your key points beforehand can help.

markers.label: Slow Pacing & Low Energy
markers.feedback: You're stretching out words to convey disappointment, but this can drain the energy from your delivery. Try using a sharper emphasis on a key word like 'really' and a downward inflection on 'unfortunate' to make your point more impactful while maintaining vocal dynamism.

markers.label: Self-Grooming Gesture
markers.feedback: Touching your hair can be a distracting sign of nervousness. Aim to keep your hands below your shoulders unless you are making a specific, purposeful gesture to add emphasis to your words.

markers.label: Clenched Fists / Tense Stance
markers.feedback: You've returned to the tense, fists-clenched stance. Make a conscious effort to keep your posture open and your hands relaxed to maintain a confident presence throughout your delivery.
